creator: schreiber@htw-dresden.de
text:
There are an endless loop in executing of ./configure 
of httpd 2.0.54.

It's likely that there is something specific to your environment which triggers
this.  Have you verified the MD5 checksum on the tarball you downloaded to
ensure it was not corrupted?  What shell are you using?  Have you tried running
configure like: "/bin/sh ./configure ..."?

I suggest you try a user support forum for further help:
http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
I ran into a similar thing after upgrading from 2.0.48 to 2.0.52.  It was unable
to resolve a db dependecy.  I had to configure with "--without-berkeley-db" to
resolve.
creator: twh@iw.net
